sessions.title: Kickstarter Agent Spark: Explore, Empower, and Envision Your First Agent
sessions.desc:
*Laptops required* Curious about agents and ready to dream up your first one? This session is for you. 
  Join us for a high-energy interactive workshop, designed to spark ideas and envision impactful agent use cases. This is not a hands-on lab, instead you’ll explore the landscape of Microsoft agent platforms and engage in a gamified strategy experience that guides you through envisioning your own agent. 
  What to expect: An overview of Microsoft agent platforms—including Microsoft 365 Copilot, Microsoft Copilot Studio (Lite and Full), and Azure AI Foundry extensibility with Microsoft Copilot Studio Practical insights into building powerful agents, enhanced with a touch of guided simulations, showing how to build a helpdesk agent and an employee onboarding autonomous agent. An interactive Spark Tank game where you will work with others to envision high-value agent scenarios Explore agent platform recommendations using an advisor tool to identify the best fit for your scenario and outline the foundational steps for your agent design. This is a goal-driven, interactive, engaging and actionable workshop designed to explore possibilities, spark ideas, and lay the foundation for your agent journey. Whether you’re just starting or looking to scale impact, this session will equip you with the insights and guidance to drive meaningful AI transformation. Planning to join the Agent Hack on October 29th? This workshop serves as an ideal launchpad to brainstorm and validate your ideas before you start building them. 
  To make the most of the experience, we encourage you to bring your laptops as you’ll be using tools to explore product capabilities. 
  Personas: Citizen and Professional Developers, Solution Architects, Enterprise Architects and Business Analysts

sessions.title: UK Welcome Reception​
sessions.loc: Tap Sports Bar located in the MGM Grand

sessions.title: Letting the Chaos Cook: Tales of the Spicy Brain Tech Renaissance
sessions.desc: What happens when neurodivergent minds meet agentic AI, automation, and a refusal to suffer through soul-crushing admin? You get Copilots born from vibes, bots that battle executive dysfunction, and automations strung together with hyperfocus and hope.   This panel brings together neurodivergent creators, thinkers, and technologists in the midst of a spicy brain tech renaissance—where automation isn’t just about productivity, but survival, accessibility, and joy. Through candid storytelling and lived experience, panelists will share how they’ve harnessed AI, Copilots, custom agents, and automations to offload boring stuff, reduce cognitive friction, and finally do the things that light their brains up.   Whether you’re ADHD, autistic, AuDHD, chronically overwhelmed, or know someone that is, this session invites you to embrace chaos as the feature it is—not a bug—and walk away with ideas (and maybe a bot or two) that could change the way you approach the mundane.

sessions.title: Making Imposter Syndrome Your SuperPower
sessions.desc: Recognize the signs of Imposter Syndrome and how it impacts confidence, productivity, and career growth. •    Identify external factors, such as workplace dynamics, immigration, and representation, that can contribute to feelings of self-doubt. •    Apply strategies to reframe Imposter Syndrome as a tool for resilience, growth, and authentic leadership. •    Develop personalized techniques to become their own strongest supporter and advocate.

sessions.title: The Three Pillars of Thriving Tech Communities
sessions.desc: Learn the proven framework for fostering user groups that thrive instead of fade away. This session reveals the three essential pillars that separate successful communities from failed ones. You'll discover practical strategies to drive data-informed decisions, sustainable growth, and effective sponsorship models. Whether you're starting a new user group or revitalizing an existing one, you'll leave with actionable steps to create a community that members want to keep attending.

sessions.title: Who’s Prompt is it Anyway – Power Platform Chicago Style Improv Theater
sessions.desc: What happens when you mix the unpredictability of improv comedy with the creativity of M365 Copilot and a touch of music? In this fast-paced, interactive session where the points don't count, the audience becomes our stars! We’ll invite brave individuals to join us on stage as “players,” using audience-suggested topics (gathered beforehand in our “Ideas from the Hat”) to create wacky, cool, and unexpected prompts. Then, we’ll push Copilot Agent and Studio tools to their creative limits—live and unscripted! Inspired by the classic “Whose Line Is It Anyway?” format, this session blends humor, adaptability, and innovation to show how great ideas emerge when humans and AI collaborate in real time. Audience participation isn’t just encouraged—it’s essential!

sessions.title: Power Platform & Central America Communities: Better Together
sessions.desc: The Power Platform "better together" spirit applies not only to the technology, but also to the people and communities. Since 2024, communities from across Central America have come together each year to host a Digital Transformation Summit, where Power Platform and AI take center stage. Discover how cross-border efforts and collaborations are making Power Platform adoption not only possible, but impactful in all Central America and other latin America countries.

sessions.title: Building a Dynamics 365 or Power Platform community in Your Area
sessions.desc:
Building a local user group for Dynamics 365 or Power Platform takes time, care, and consistency, but the rewards are worth it. 
  Over the past 10 years, I’ve helped grow Dynamics and Power Platform user group community in the UK from a single group to twelve user groups. We’ve built a Meetup community with over 3,000 members and a LinkedIn group that’s active and growing. Our user groups host 30+ in person and virtual meetings per year across the UK. 
  In this session, I’ll share what I’ve learned about getting a group started and keeping it going. We’ll cover how to run your first events, how to reach the right people and what it takes to build something that lasts. You’ll hear what’s worked, what hasn’t and how to avoid the common mistakes I’ve seen along the way. 
  Key takeaways: - How to get your first meetup off the ground - Tools and platforms that can help you grow - Tips for long-term engagement and sustainable growth - Lessons from running user groups for over a decade 
  If you’re thinking about starting a group or want to build more momentum with an existing one, this session will give you practical steps to make it happen.

sessions.title: Tips to Running a Power Platform User Group
sessions.desc: Thinking about starting a Power Platform User Group — or making yours better? In this session, we’ll cover the do’s, don’ts, and “wish I knew sooner” moments of running a thriving community. Expect tips on building partnerships, creating hands-on events, and leveraging social media to boost attendance. You’ll learn how to secure speakers, plan relevant content, encourage participation, and keep momentum going all year long. Perfect for anyone interested in starting or revitalizing a user group in their local area!

list.name: Ryley Bauer
list.title: CAO (Chief Automation Officer) / Automation and Productivity Consultant
list.label: Speaker

sessions.title: From the Seats to the Stage: Our Journey Through Community
sessions.desc: Going from the audience to the stage was not a straight line. It was a messy path full of detours, a few lucky breaks, and a lot of people who opened doors when you finally start knocking. In this session, you will learn how community can change everything. You will learn about mentors who became family, the first time taking risks paid off, and the moment you realize that sharing what you know is not bragging — it is how you pay it forward. You will learn the practical steps that can take you from quiet attendee to confident speaker and the habits that build consistent growth. You will also learn what actually matters if you want to become a Microsoft MVP. Spoiler alert. It is less about titles and more about consistent impact. If you are new to the community or wondering why anyone would care about your story, you will learn that this is your permission slip to jump in. The community that changed our lives can change yours too.

sessions.title: Build Local, Lead Industry: The Power of User Groups for the AEC industry
sessions.desc: Discover how two very different and thriving communities, the Atlanta based Dynamics User Group, and the online based Dynamics User Group for AEC (Architecture, Engineering and Construction), are driving connection, collaboration, and career growth. Whether you are in the region or the industry, learn how joining a user group can elevate your journey!

sessions.title: Meet the Microsoft Power Platform Governance and Security Team
sessions.desc: Swing by for a meet and greet with the Microsoft Governance and Security team!

sessions.title: AMA - Community-Powered Steps to MVP and Speaking
sessions.desc: Curious about becoming a speaker or MVP but not sure where to start? In this AMA, I’ll share how the community helped me take the leap—from first talk nerves to finding my voice. Bring your questions and let’s chat about how you can get started too!

sessions.title: Master Power Platform for $0: Free Resources You Can’t Miss!
sessions.desc: Discover how anyone can start learning Microsoft Power Platform with zero cost and unlimited potential. In this 20-minute session, we’ll explore the best free resources — from Power Up and Microsoft Learn to “In a Day” workshops and Applied Skills certifications. You’ll leave with a clear roadmap to gain hands-on experience, sharpen your skills, and kickstart your journey toward  becoming a Power Platform professional.

sessions.title: Power Platform Security 404 - A Murder Mystery Where You’re The Detective!
sessions.desc: VNets, Gateways, DLP, Outbound Traffic -- all terms that spook even the most senior engineer, but not you! In this action-packed detective adventure, we’ll dive into all the hidden security risks of Power Platform and how to prevent them.

sessions.title: Amplify Your Voice: Sharing Stories That Inspire and Drive Impact
sessions.desc: Your story has the power to inspire change, spark innovation, and shape the future of your industry. In this session, we’ll explore meaningful ways you can share your success—from impactful real-world stories to broader opportunities that showcase your vision, creativity, and results. Learn how your story can reach a wider audience through external channels and social platforms, helping to elevate your brand, build credibility, and connect with peers. Whether you're just getting started or ready to go bigger, this session will offer practical guidance to help you amplify your voice and make your story count.

sessions.title: The Future of Microsoft Communities: Staying Human in a Digital-First World
sessions.desc: As technology evolves, so do the communities that power it. In an era of AI, automation, and hybrid work, how do we keep the human connection alive? This session explores the future of tech communities—what’s changing, what’s staying the same, and why human-centred design matters more than ever. We’ll dive into trends shaping community building, from global reach to inclusive engagement, and share practical strategies to create spaces where people feel seen, heard, and valued. Whether you’re a community leader, contributor, or just curious about what’s next, you’ll leave with actionable ideas to future-proof your community and keep it thriving in a digital-first world.

sessions.title: Extra Life, Next Level: How Freelancing Can Maximise Your Income AND Your Work-life Balance
sessions.desc: A quick-fire session from a successful career freelancer and a Power Platform specialist recruiter who has recently taken the leap to freedom! We’ll discuss the first principles of freelance, the key things you need to know to be successful, and actions you can take to fill any gaps. Personal brand is one of the most important things you need to promote your business and we’ll show you how to become the ‘go-to’ for your niche services. You’ll also learn how to build the tools and assets needed to free up your time and allow more life. If you’re looking to build a business that supports the life you want, work from anywhere, anytime and choose how you do business, this is the session for you! You’ll come away with a fundamental understanding of what your next steps should be if you’re serious about becoming a freelancer and living life on your terms!

list.name: Franco Musso
list.title: Freelance Power Pages specialist with an unhealthy obsession for experimenting, learning and empowering others
list.label: Speaker

sessions.title: We started a user group and gained 1,000 followers in 6 months! Want to know how to contribute to your community?
sessions.desc: Are you wondering what is the best way to contribute to your community? Podcast, blog, run a user group? This light hearted and fun session will tell the story of two friends who wanted to create something fun. Something not too corporate, and a safe space where everyone is welcome, including first time speakers. We’ll talk through our journey and how it’s even supported a transition into freelancing. In this session you’ll hear our story about how we got started, from setting boundaries, finding a unique and meaningful name, getting the word out in a fun way (worst kept secret) and attracting speakers. We’ll teach you all about consistency with branding, cadence of events, giving your speakers the VIP treatment and how to continuously grow your following from 0 to 1,000 and get nominated for a Microsoft Community Award within six months. If you’re looking to start a thing, where you can have fun, learn and encourage others, this is the session for you!

sessions.title: Power Platform Unleashed: Are You Ready for the Inflection Point?
sessions.desc: The digital transformation is no longer on the horizon—it’s here. In this session, we’ll briefly share the journey of how our IT and Business teams are partnering to unlock the potential of the Power Platform, navigating challenges and building a foundation for scalable success. But this isn’t just our journey—it’s yours too. Let’s explore the critical inflection point where citizen development shifts from exception to expectation, and where Makers play a pivotal role in digital transformation. Through interactive discussion, we’ll invite you to reflect on your own enablement strategies, share lessons learned, and prepare for what’s next. Are you ready to unleash the full power of the platform?

sessions.title: Super-Heroes Assemble! Take your D365 and Power Platform Community forum contributions to the next level
sessions.desc: Are you active on the community forum, or do you want to be? Do you want to take your community contributions to the next level and define your own personal brand?   Then this session is for you! ? Join the super users in this engaging session on how to leverage your experience and skills to create lasting impact on the Microsoft Community forums! In this session, you will learn: •    How to write impactful questions and replies •    How to set up infrastructure to review your community replies •    How to leverage AI technology to take your replies to the next level ...and much, much more! And maybe we'll also have some fun along the way!

sessions.title: Two Super Users talking about stuff - but not on the community forum!
sessions.desc: "What's your biggest win on the forum?" "What's the most awkward reply you’ve written by mistake?" ...and many, many more! Join Super Users Thomas and Jonas (and maybe others — they just don’t know it yet ?) for an audience-engaging, smack-talking session about all things Super User! No agenda, just pure vibes, and a chat about everything Super User on the Dynamics and Power Platform Community forum.

sessions.title: Women In Power: The Power of Mentorship and Networking
sessions.desc:
Join Women in Power (WiP) - a growing grassroots community of women and allies in the Microsoft Power Platform ecosystem for a dynamic, interactive session where you drive the conversation.   It’s a space to get real. Together, we’ll step into the heart of WiP and explore the untold stories behind the stats: stories that spotlight the importance of mentorship, reveal the impact of skilling, and celebrate what’s helping women in our ecosystem get where they want to go.   Through live audience interaction, real-world stories, and open discussion, we’ll crowdsource insights, surface shared challenges, and co-create solutions. Whether you’re early in your journey, deep into leadership, or showing up for the community, you’ll leave with practical ways to make an impact right away. 
  In this session, you’ll: •    Learn how to get involved with the Women in Power movement •    Share and hear real-world stories, challenges, and turning points •    Walk away with concrete ways to uplift, mentor, and advocate for yourself, and others

list.name: Geetha Sivasailam
list.title: Microsoft Business Applications MVP | #PowerAddict | Power Platform Practice Lead
list.label: Speaker

list.name: Danielle Moon
list.title: Founder, Women in Power (Platform) | Sr. Specialist
list.label: Speaker

sessions.title: Expert Panel: The Impact of AI on Power Platform and App Development
sessions.desc: What happens when AI is no longer just an assistant, but becomes the core of your app experience? In this panel, experts and MVPs will unpack how intelligent agents and copilots are moving from helpful tools to essential components in the next generation of Power Platform solutions.   Why does this matter? Because the way we build apps is about to change - and quickly. From how we define requirements to how we deliver the apps themselves; AI will influence (or replace?) every step.   This session will be an open discussion between experienced consultants, architects and developers exploring what’s coming, what to watch out for and how to prepare yourself and your team now.   This is your chance to gain insight into how AI will transform the Power Platform landscape in the years ahead.

sessions.title: Everything I Needed for Tech I Learned From Art
sessions.desc: What does learning a piece of music or building a character on stage have to do with deploying a Power Platform solution? More than you might think. This session explores the surprising lessons that artistic disciplines like piano, acting, and storytelling bring to solution design, user adoption, and a career in the Power Platform.  Through real-world examples, we’ll look at how artistic practices, like breaking complex music into sections or working on a film set, mirror the steps needed to design and deliver successful technology projects. Attendees will leave with a fresh perspective and practical techniques they can apply immediately, from mastering new technology to building user experiences that resonate emotionally and drive lasting engagement.

sessions.title: Likes, Links, and Learning: The Power Platform Community Multiplier
sessions.desc: The Power Platform’s most powerful feature isn’t in the product - it’s in the people. Through blogs, LinkedIn, YouTube, user groups, and beyond, I’ve discovered how community engagement multiplies learning, confidence, and opportunity. Technical skills open doors, but it’s the community that swings them wide open - helping you build networks, visibility, and friendships that last. My journey from participant to leading two user groups has shown me that every like, comment, blog, or meetup can spark something bigger than you expect. In this talk, I’ll share my playbook for turning simple acts of sharing into life-changing opportunities, and why being proactive in the community is the best investment you can make. Whether you start with a single post, blog or a meetup visit, you’ll see how quickly those small actions compound into a powerful impact. You don’t need to be an expert to start - you just need to take your first step

sessions.title: Plan Designer Pandemonium: An MVP Mad Libs Adventure
sessions.desc:
What happens when you hand two MVPs a live audience, Plan Designer, and zero script? Absolute shenanigans. In this interactive session, Cat and Julie will build a solution live on stage using nothing but audience suggestions — business problems, roles, data, and a few wild curveballs. Watch as chaos is transformed into clarity with Plan Designer’s ability to instantly map ideas into a data model and starter apps. 
  Come for the laughs, stay for the “aha” moments: you’ll see just how fast Plan Designer can turn imagination into reality — and walk away ready to run your own team brainstorms that are equal parts fun and functional.

sessions.title: Unlock AI Confidence with Power Up
sessions.desc: Power Up Technology is moving fast, and staying ahead means staying curious. In this session, you’ll learn how Power Up makes AI upskilling simple, practical, and accessible—no technical background required. We’ll talk about why continuous learning is essential in today’s workplace and share easy ways to start small now, so you can build confidence and make a big impact tomorrow.

sessions.title: Build Your First Power Pages Site in 20 Minutes!
sessions.desc: Think you need to be a developer to build a website? Think again! In this fast-paced, interactive session, you’ll watch a Power Pages site come to life before your eyes — from a blank canvas to a polished, functional business site in just 15 minutes. Whether you’re brand new to Power Platform or just curious about how easy it can be, you’ll leave inspired and ready to create your own site that looks great, works beautifully, and is surprisingly simple to build. We’ll walk through the key design steps, customize pages and forms, and publish with confidence — all while having a little fun along the way. Bring your curiosity and get ready to say, “I can totally do this!”

sessions.desc: Across the globe, Microsoft communities—both new and established—hold incredible potential to inspire, empower, and uplift. In this session, we’ll uncover the key ingredients behind lasting, impactful Microsoft communities. From tapping into official programs and partner benefits to adopting proven best practices, we’ll explore what it really takes to grow and sustain a strong, purpose-driven community. Whether you're leading a user group, launching a tech initiative, or simply passionate about helping others, this session offers practical insights, real-world examples, and a renewed sense of purpose to fuel your community journey. Let’s build not just active communities but empowered movements.
